documents.document: “The biggest challenge I face is getting to treatment. It’s hard getting the transportation to get around.” #healhcareforthehomeless

“The biggest challenge I had trying to overcome my addiction was not having insurance. I got the comprehensive help that I needed at Healthcare for the Homeless in Baltimore. I’m grateful because today I see a better future.”

Dealing with the stigma of opioid addiction discourages ppl from seeking treatment. Access to treatment is also a problem, ppl who need treatment can’t get it due to lack of slots. It should be available 4 everybody. “You gave a hopeless person some hope.” #TheCAREAct

Addiction is a medical disorder not a moral failing or criminal issue. The passage of #TheCAREAct would support infrastructure and implementation to save lists of lives. We have a huge workforce shortage, we need more counselors. Dr. Jones @bonsecoursbalt

Long term funding 4 substance abuse treatment would make a critical difference in the #OpioidEpidemic. Wrap around services are important 4 ppl who have other issues: life skills training, housing, childcare. #TheCAREAct would help address these needs.

#ACA brought the insured rate at Healthcare for the Homeless in Baltimore from 30% to 90%, thus giving homeless ppl access to health services, including addiction treatment, 4 the first time in years. Thank u @BarackObama & @NancyPelosi

.@NICKIMINAJ Maybe you can do a live performance, video or photo shoot invoking the life and spirit of “Harriet Tubman”. We have the perfect spot reserved for it in #Baltimore, a prominent stop in Tubman’s Underground Railroad.
Of course, the contributions of "Harriet Tubman" far outweigh the issue of album sales, but we will take what we can get in terms of publicity promoting this great female freedom fighter.

.@NICKIMINAJ Since U C yourself as "Harriet Tubman" can you come to #Baltimore to help us erect a statue or a mural to this great female freedom fighter from #Maryland? We need to bring more attention to her contributions & finally give her the respect she deserves.

In fact, when a local group commissioned an artist to do a "Harriet Tubman" mural for #baltimore, it was rejected because she was holding a musket. The artist was asked to change the musket to a staff but refused. https://t.co/wIAXmaDPqf

It's been a year since confederate statues were removed from #Baltimore and no statue or mural honoring "Harriet Tubman" has been announced or erected. She is Maryland's most famous female freedom fighter and deserves to be honored for her courage, bravery & accomplishments.
